intro: Galium rhodopeum, commonly known as the Rhodope bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Galium rhodopeum is often found in mountainous regions and is adapted to cool, temperate climates.
